Author: luxorange
Text: This might be not what you want because it has quinoa, but I like to do Mark Bittman's [Autumn Millet Bake](https://www.101cookbooks.com/archives/mark-bittmans-autumn-millet-bake-recipe.html). It's a hot dish, and the main ingredients are quinoa and butternut squash. It's Thanksgiving-y, warm, and good.  The recipe calls for olive oil, but you can sub extra broth. The entire thing is very easy to make substitutions on, I've made it with a ton of different alterations/leaving stuff out/etc and it always comes out good. It's flexible.
